drawEqu

Class houghLine

  • java.lang.Object
    • drawEqu.houghLine

  • public class houghLine
extends java.lang.Object
    it represents an equation for each line generated from the hough transform this equation depends on an angle(theta) and a perpendicular line (R)
    Author:
    Hoda, Menna

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      houghLine(double th, double r)
      constructor which initiate the theta ( angle between main axis in the image and the perpendicular on a line ) and R ( perpendicular line )

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void Draw(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image, int color, int height, int width, int X1, int Y1, int X2, int Y2)
      This function draws a line using the theta and R which is the perpendicular from origin to the line
      java.util.Vector<java.lang.Double> formEquation(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
      This function form an equation for a line in the image and return an equation along with end points in the vector

    • Method Detail

      • formEquation

        public java.util.Vector<java.lang.Double> formEquation(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
        This function form an equation for a line in the image and return an equation along with end points in the vector
        Parameters:
        image - the image chosen by the user to form an equation for it
        Returns:
        a vector of double which contains the theta (which is the angle between perpendicular on the line and axis) and R (the perpendicular) along with the x-coordinates and y-coordinates boundaries of the line

      • Draw

        public void Draw(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
        int color,
        int height,
        int width,
        int X1,
        int Y1,
        int X2,
        int Y2)
        This function draws a line using the theta and R which is the perpendicular from origin to the line
        Parameters:
        image - buffered image to draw a line from an equation using theta and R
        color - color chosen by the user to draw his new image with it
        height - the height of the image
        width - the width of the image boundaries of the line
        x1 -
        y1 -
        x2 -
        y2 -
